Building Model Formula

Source: R/formula.R
build_formula.Rd

This builds the model formula which is used inside fit_mmrm() and provided to mmrm::mmrm() internally. It can be instructive to look at the resulting formula directly sometimes.

Usage

build_formula(
  vars,
  cor_struct = c("unstructured", "heterogeneous toeplitz", "auto-regressive",
    "heterogeneous auto-regressive", "heterogeneous ante-dependence")
)

Arguments

vars

(list)
variables to use in the model.

cor_struct

(string)
specify the covariance structure to use.

Value

Formula to use in mmrm::mmrm().

Examples

vars <- list(
  response = "AVAL", covariates = c("RACE", "SEX"),
  id = "USUBJID", arm = "ARMCD", visit = "AVISIT"
)
build_formula(vars, "auto-regressive")
#> AVAL ~ RACE + SEX + ARMCD * AVISIT + ar1(AVISIT | USUBJID)
#> <environment: 0x55cbb285f010>
build_formula(vars)
#> AVAL ~ RACE + SEX + ARMCD * AVISIT + us(AVISIT | USUBJID)
#> <environment: 0x55cbb28cdd50>

On this page

tern.mmrm is a part of the NEST and pharmaverse.
